00051 RowFile::RowFile(char delimChar, char commentChar, char commentChar2):
00052    m_Buffer(NULL), m_BufferSize(0), m_LineIx(0),
00053   m_Delim(delimChar), m_Comment(commentChar), m_Comment2(commentChar2), 
00054   m_Reuse(false) {
00055 }

00061 void RowFile::open(const std::string& fileName) {
00062   m_FileName = fileName;
00063   m_In.open(fileName.c_str(), ios_base::in);
00064   if(m_In.fail()) {
00065     Err::errAbort("Can't open file " + string(fileName) + " to read.");
00066   }
00067   m_EndType = determineLineEndingType(m_In);
00068 }

00073 RowFile::~RowFile() { 
00074   if(m_Buffer) {
00075     delete[] m_Buffer;
00076   } 
00077   if(m_In.is_open()) { 
00078     m_In.close(); 
00079   }
00080 };

00085 void RowFile::close() {
00086   m_In.close();
00087 }

00095 const string *RowFile::nextLine() {
00096   
00097   /* If we're reusing this line just return it again. */
00098   if(m_Reuse) {
00099     m_Reuse = false;
00100     return &m_CurrentLine;
00101   }
00102   /* if end of file return NULL. */
00103   if(m_In.eof())
00104     return NULL;
00105   /* Check stream state. */
00106   if(m_In.fail())
00107     Err::errAbort("Something bad happened before line: " + 
00108                     ToStr(m_LineIx));
00109 
00110   /* Little logic to handle the different line endings possible. */
00111   if(m_EndType == MAC) {
00112     getline(m_In, m_CurrentLine, '\r');
00113   }
00114   else { 
00115     getline(m_In, m_CurrentLine, '\n');
00116     // if ms-dos chop off the '\r'
00117     if(m_EndType == DOS && m_CurrentLine.length() > 0) 
00118       m_CurrentLine.erase(m_CurrentLine.end() - 1);
00119   }
00120   Util::trimString(m_CurrentLine);
00121   m_LineIx++;
00122   return &m_CurrentLine;
00123 }
00124 
00131 const string *RowFile::nextRealLine() {
00132   unsigned int notWhiteSpace = 0;
00133   while( nextLine() != NULL) {
00134     notWhiteSpace = 0;
00135     // Skip the first not white space.
00136     while(notWhiteSpace < m_CurrentLine.size() &&
00137           isspace(m_CurrentLine[notWhiteSpace]))
00138       notWhiteSpace++;
00139     // If found we found a line with characters that doesn't start
00140     // with a comment return true.
00141     if(m_CurrentLine.size() != 0 && 
00142        m_CurrentLine[notWhiteSpace] != m_Comment && 
00143        m_CurrentLine[notWhiteSpace] != m_Comment2)
00144       return &m_CurrentLine;
00145   }
00146   // never found a real line.
00147   return NULL;
00148 }
00149 
00155 bool RowFile::nextRow(std::vector<std::string> &words) {
00156   int len = 0, start = 0, next = 0;
00157 
00158   if(nextRealLine() == NULL)
00159     return false;
00160   words.clear();
00161   len = m_CurrentLine.size();
00162 
00163   while(start < len) {
00164     next = (int)m_CurrentLine.find(m_Delim, start);
00165     if(next < 0) {
00166       next = m_CurrentLine.size(); // entire string.
00167     }
00168     words.push_back(m_CurrentLine.substr(start, next - start));
00169     start = next+1;
00170   }
00171   return true;
00172 }
00173 
00181 bool RowFile::nextCStringRowExpect(std::vector<const char *> &words, unsigned int expect) {
00182   if(!nextCStringRow(words))
00183     return false;
00184   if(words.size() != expect) {
00185     Err::errAbort("Got " + ToStr(words.size()) +
00186                     " words instead of " + ToStr(expect) +
00187                     " expected at line: " + ToStr(m_LineIx));
00188   }
00189   return true;
00190 }
00191 
00199 bool RowFile::nextCStringRow(std::vector<const char *> &words) {
00200   int len = 0, start = 0, next = 0;
00201   char *mark = 0;
00202   char *buff = 0;
00203 
00204   if(nextRealLine() == NULL)
00205     return false;
00206   words.clear();
00207   len = m_CurrentLine.size();
00208 
00209   /* Use the m_Buffer to copy strings into to avoid lots of new's and
00210      deletes. Only expand when necessary. */
00211   if(len + 1 > m_BufferSize) {
00212     FreezArray(m_Buffer);
00213     m_BufferSize = len+1;
00214      m_Buffer = new char[m_BufferSize];
00215   }
00216   //strncpy(m_Buffer, m_CurrentLine.c_str(), len);
00217   memcpy(m_Buffer, m_CurrentLine.c_str(), len);
00218   buff = m_Buffer;
00219   
00220   /* Trim off any delimiters at beginning and end of line */
00221   while(start < len) {
00222     if(!isspace(m_CurrentLine[start])) 
00223       break;
00224     start++;
00225   }
00226   while(len > start) {
00227     if(!isspace(m_CurrentLine[len -1]))
00228       break;
00229     m_Buffer[len - 1] = '\0';
00230     len--;
00231   }
00232 
00233   /* Loop through and cut up lines into words based on delimiter. */
00234   while(start < len) {
00235     next = (int)m_CurrentLine.find(m_Delim, start);
00236     if(next < 0) {
00237       next = m_CurrentLine.size(); // entire string.
00238     }
00239     mark = buff+next;
00240     *mark = '\0';
00241     words.push_back(buff+start);
00242     start = next+1;
00243   }
00244   return true;
00245 }

00255 bool RowFile::nextRowExpect(std::vector<std::string> &words, unsigned int expect) {
00256   if(!nextRow(words))
00257     return false;
00258   if(words.size() != expect) {
00259     Err::errAbort("Got " + ToStr(words.size()) +
00260                     " words instead of " + ToStr(expect) +
00261                     " expected at line: " + ToStr(m_LineIx));
00262   }
00263   return true;
00264 }

00266 void RowFile::readHeader(RowFile &rf, std::map<std::string, std::vector<std::string> > &header,
00267                          std::vector<std::string> &lines) {
00268   char delim = '=';
00269   int startPos = 0;
00270   string::size_type delimPos = 0;
00271   const string *line = NULL;
00272   while((line = rf.nextLine()) != NULL) {
00273     startPos = 0;
00274     /* Header is prefixed by '%' or "#%" */
00275     if(line->length() == 0)
00276       continue;
00277     else if(line->length() > 1 && (*line)[0] == rf.m_Comment && (*line)[1] == rf.m_Comment2)
00278       startPos = 2;
00279     else if(line->length() > 0 && (*line)[0] == rf.m_Comment2)
00280       startPos = 1;
00281     else {
00282       rf.reuseLine();
00283       break;
00284     }    
00285     lines.push_back(string(*line));
00286     delimPos = line->find(delim);
00287     if(delimPos == string::npos) 
00288       Err::errAbort("Couldn't find delimiter: '" + ToStr(delim) + 
00289                       "' in line:\n" + string(*line));
00290     string key = line->substr(startPos, delimPos-startPos);
00291     string value = line->substr(delimPos+1, line->length());
00292     if(header.find(key) == header.end()) {
00293       // first time seen, create a new vector of values.
00294       vector<string> vals;
00295       vals.push_back(value);
00296       header[key] = vals;
00297     }
00298     else {
00299       vector<string> &vals = header[key];
00300       vals.push_back(value);
00301     }
00302   }   
00303 } 
00304 
00308 void RowFile::writeHeader(std::ostream &out, const std::vector<std::string> &lines) {
00309   typedef vector<string>::const_iterator vecI;
00310   vecI i;
00311   for(i = lines.begin(); i != lines.end(); ++i) 
00312     out << *i << endl;
00313 }

00322 void RowFile::matrixFromFile(const std::string& fileName,
00323                              std::vector< std::vector<double> > &matrix,
00324                              unsigned int skipLines, unsigned int skipCols) {
00325   RowFile rf;
00326   unsigned int i = 0;
00327   vector<string> words;
00328   rf.open(fileName.c_str());
00329   for(i = 0; i < skipLines; i++)
00330     rf.nextRow(words);
00331   while(rf.nextRow(words)) {
00332     if(skipCols >= words.size()) 
00333       Err::errAbort("RowFile::matrixFromFile() - Number of skipCols >= number of cols.");
00334     matrix.push_back(vector<double>());
00335     for(i = skipCols; i < words.size(); i++) {
00336       matrix[matrix.size() -1].push_back(Convert::toDouble(words[i].c_str()));
00337     }
00338   }
00339 }
00340 
00348 void RowFile::matrixFromFile(const std::string& fileName,
00349                              std::vector< std::vector<float> > &matrix,
00350                              unsigned int skipLines, unsigned int skipCols) {
00351   RowFile rf;
00352   unsigned int i = 0;
00353   vector<string> words;
00354   rf.open(fileName.c_str());
00355   for(i = 0; i < skipLines; i++)
00356     rf.nextRow(words);
00357   while(rf.nextRow(words)) {
00358     if(skipCols >= words.size()) 
00359       Err::errAbort("RowFile::matrixFromFile() - Number of skipCols >= number of cols.");
00360     matrix.push_back(vector<float>());
00361     for(i = skipCols; i < words.size(); i++) {
00362       matrix[matrix.size() -1].push_back(Convert::toFloat(words[i].c_str()));
00363     }
00364   }
00365 }

00373 enum RowFile::FileLineEnding RowFile::determineLineEndingType(std::ifstream &input) {
00374   FileLineEnding ending = UNKNOWN;
00375   while(input.good()) {
00376     char c1 = input.get();
00377     // '\r' alone indicates mac, '\r\n' indicates dos
00378     if(c1 == '\r') {
00379       if(input.good() && input.get() == '\n') {
00380         ending = DOS;
00381       }
00382       else {
00383         ending = MAC;
00384       }
00385       break;
00386     }
00387     // is it a unix file?
00388     else if(c1 == '\n') {
00389       ending = UNIX;
00390       break;
00391     }
00392   }
00393   // reset stream back to beginning of file.
00394   input.seekg(0);
00395   return ending;
00396 }
